sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I n v i e w o f t h e p u c i t y o f a r c t i c m a t e r i a l i t was a g r e a t p l e a s u r e f o r m e t o be able t o e x a n f i n e t h e large c o l l e c t i o n o f t e r r e s t r i a l N e m a t o d a m a d e b y Mr. A. M a c f a d y e n o n J a n M a y e n i n 1947; I s h o u l d h e r e like t o t h a n k Mr. Maefadyen for the material. The animals were fixed in Bouin's fluid a n d were, o n t h e whole, i n g o o d c o n d i t i o n; t h e collections c o n t a i n b u t t w o o f t h e species m e n t i o n e d b y S t e i n e r (1918) (see T a b l e I I), but. i n c l u d e f o r t y -t h r e e species b e l o n g i n g t o t w e l v e g e n e r a, o n e genus, o n e species a n d o n e s u b f o r m b e i n g n e w t o science.

sec.title: Orphanage

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I n the sample h'om b3 was f o u n d a female of this genus, which seems to be closely related to P. parietinus, to which it is similar in t h e shape of the head, provided with well=developed lips, t h e (esophagus h a v i n g a large bulb a n d in the tail, being short, conical, r o u n d e d a t the posterior end, with pointed t i p a n d containing three glands in t h e anterior half.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Especially characteristic of this form is ~he very spacious buccal cavity (tube), which is twice as long as wide. I t s length is 13.11~ a n d width 6.56~. Also remarkable is t h e v e r y strongly developed cardia of this new form.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: F i n a l l y t h e lateral organs are s i t u a t e d at the middle of t h e buccal t u b e a n d consisting of a simple circular sling.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The body is o f nearly e v e n thickness from t h e posterior end of the oesophagus t o the anus and t a p e r s only gradually in t h e foremost p a r t o f the (esophageal region.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The cuticle is finely annulated. The head is rounded, a n d papillate at the front end.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The small buccal c a v i t y is cylindrical t o funnel-shaped. Lateral organs situated 16 t~ behind the front end, simply spiral-shaped, 2t~ in section, i.e. 2/9 of t h e corresponding head-diameter.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Esophagus elongated, thin, posteriorly w i t h a moderately large, strongly muscular bulb.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Although the tail seems t o be relatively longer a n d narrower than de Man has figured it, the specimens from Jan Mayen are rather typical representatives of this easily recognizable, terrestrial, long-tailed species, described first b y Biitschli in 1873 from " roots o f different fungi "

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I n the male there seems to be a single tubular d u c t in front o f t h e anus.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Female organs paired, symmetrical, probably with reflexed ovaries.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I n a female was found an egg with the dimensions: 54/~ x 28 t*.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Very similar t o P geophilus de Man in the shape o f the buccal c a v i t y and rather cylindrical tail. It differs, however, from that species in the slender, more elongated bristles a n d in t h e lateral organs being situated at a greater distance behind the front end than de Man figured them. The oesophagus seems to be evenly elongated as in t h e specimen, figured b y de Man.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The b o d y is v e r y slehder. Cephalic bristles s i t u a t e d submedially, as large as or only a little shorter t h a n the head-diameter a t the same level. The buccal c a v i t y is short, large, cylindrical, a b o u t twice as deep as broad. The (esophagus increases almost imperceptibly t o w a r d s the posterior end.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The tail is exceedingly elongated, v e r y slender, posteriorly pointed. The v u l v a is s i t u a t e d in front of the middle of the body. Female organs paired with short gonads, t h e anterior of which is reflexed dorsally, the posterior gonad ventrally.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Fam. Chromadoridae .

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: M ACFA DYENIA ,gen. nov.*

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Very remarkable genus o f terrestrial nematodes, the systematic position of which remains uncertain.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I n its general shape similar t o the Chromadorids, especially to the genus Euchromadora de M a n; it differs from this earlier genus in the following points:- -

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: (l) the thin, smooth, not annulated cuticle; (2) the irregularly shaped dorsal tooth; and (3) the rather large, strongly muscular o esophageal bulb.

sec.p: Dimensions.—Body-length=1.088 mm., max. width = 0.0 4 0 mm., oesophagus=0.090 mm., tail=0.3 0 0 mm., vulva= 0. 4 5 2 mm., α = 2 7. 2, β =1 2.0 9, y = 3.63, V = 41.54 per cent.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The body is, on the whole, of even thickness and tapers almost imperceptibly in the oesophageal region and posteriorly up to the anus.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The cuticle is thin and smooth. The head is rounded, a t the front end provided with sublaterally situated, fine bristles.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The buccal cavity is supported a t the front end b y eight ribs and armed with a v e r y large, transversely situated, irregularly shaped, dorsal tooth, the point o f which is directed forwards. Opposite to this tooth there is also a smaller, acute, ventral tooth.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Lateral organs were not discernible. The oesophagus is short, strongly contracted, thick, with a large, oval, s t r o n g l y muscular bulb.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The tail is elongated and tapers conically only in the foremost part and is very narrow for most o f its length, posteriorly rather gradually tapering, whip-like.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The vulva is situated in front o f the middle o f the body.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Female organs paired, with reflexed ovaries, the anterior o v a r y being b e n t dorsally, the posterior o v a r y ventrally.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Dorylairaus carteri B a s t. lugdunensis (de Man). (Fig. 7.) Dorylaimus lugdunensis de Man, 1884, p. 182, pl. xxx, fig. 127. Dorylaimus carteri Bast. lugdunensis (de Man) Micoletzky, 1922. To judge b y t h e n u m e r o u s finds of this long-tailed, easily recognizable species, which is smaller a n d more slender t h a n D. agilis, it is a v e r y c o m m o n i n h a b i t a n t o f t h e soil o f J a n Mayen. The male, at first discovered a n d described b y Steiner (1916 (3) pp. 99-100), is p r o b a b l y v e r y rare. A m o n g f o r t y -s e v e n females from different localities only a single t y p i c a l male was f o u n d in a sample from B2 (21). Besides t h e anal papilla, s i t u a t e d a litt,le in front o f t h e anus, there is a row of twelve v e r y small papillae, p a r t l y s i t u a t e d a t u n e q u a l distances from each other.

The spear o f t h e buccal c a v i t y is v e r y r e m a r k a b l e and strongly developed, and t h e shape o f the tail, measuring only 0.7 o f the anal b o d y - diameter, is quite characteristic. sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: 111 the sample from J2 was recorded a juvenile female o f the genus M o n o n c h u s Bastian, which in its general shape seems to agree rather well with M. l~apillatu~' Bast.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: This applies especially to the shape of the buccal cavity, which is ~u'med with a v e r y anterior dorsal tooth.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The front end is e v i d e n t l y r o u n d e d b u t not bent o u t w a r d s as in the species of de Man (pl. ix, fig. 35).

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I t should bc mentioned t h a t t h e ventral wall of the buccal c a v i t y of the J a n M a y e n specimen is v e r y finely toothed.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The ventral wall m o s t l y is a b s o l u t e l y smooth, not t o o t h e d as in M. muscorum Duj., closely related t o this species, a n d Bastian, who first described M. papillatus, also figured it in such a manner.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Ditlevsen (1911) has, however, p o i n t e d o u t t h a t Biitschli (1873) figured a h e a d of M. papillatus, t h e v e n t r a l wall o f t h e buccal c a v i t y o f which is e v i d e n t l y toothed, although not so strongly as in t h e a l t e r n a t i v e species.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: According t o Mieoletzky it m a y sometimes, when t h e ventral wall is more s t r o n g l y (sharply) t o o t h e d, be v e r y difficult to s e p a r a t e this species from t h e old M. muscorum.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I n this respect especially t h e s t r u c t u r e o f the buccal c a v i t y o f the J a n M a y e n specimen, t h e v e n t r a l wall o f which is e v i d e n t l y b u t more w e a k l y t o o t h e d t h a n in M. muscorum, seems t o agree r a t h e r well w i t h the figure given b y Btitschli.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Only t h e tail differs from this e s t a b l i s h e d cosmopolitan species, since it certainly t a p e r s gradually posteriorly b u t seems to be a little more elongated a n d slender t h a n in the type-specimen, figured b y de Man.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: PARACHROMAGASTERIELLA Allg6n.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Parachromagasteriella arctica, sp. n. (Fig. 9.)

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: D i m e n s i o n s.- -B o d y -l e n g t h=l.2 2 6 mm., max. width=0.0 3 0 ram., oesophagus=0.197 ram., t a i l=0.0 8 2 mm., v u l v a=0.6 2 5 mm., ~=4 0.8 7, fl =6.26, 7,=14.95, V =5 0.9 8 per cent.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I n the sample from L2 was f o u n d a single specimen (a female? of a n Araeolaimoid, which seems t o resemble this group o f n e m a t o d e s n o t only in its general shape b u t also in t h e presence o f oeell0e a n d in the shape a n d structure o f t h e lateral organs. W i t h respect t o t h e last-named organs it is v e r y similar to t h e genus Parachromagasteriella, described b y the a u t h o r (1933) from N o r w a y, from which it differs o n l y in the presence o f ocell~e.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The b o d y is, on the whole, o f e v e n thickness a n d tapers only gradually t o w a r d s t h e head a n d scarcely n o t i c e a b l y in ti'ont of the anus.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Cuticle smooth. The h e a d is r o u n d e d a n d t h e foremost p a r t slightly d e m a r c a t e d b y a constriction from the rest of the head, a n d is j u s t in this constriction p r o v i d e d with four s u b m e d i a n bristles, measuring h a l f the corresponding head-diameter.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Buccal c a v i t y (tube) thin. L a t e r a l organs r a t h e r remarkable, o f a shape characteristic o f the Araeolaimoidea. T h e y are s i t u a t e d 9tz behind t h e front end, simply spiral-shaped, with a posterior branch, and, as s t a t e d above, v e r y similar to those of the marine genus Parachromagasteriella Allg6n. T h e y measure in t r a n s v e r s e section 3 ~, i.e. e x a c t l y 1/3 of the corresponding body-diameter.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Ocell~e s i t u a t e d 36/z behind t h e t~ont, end, eolourless, cube-shaped. Cephalad and c a u d a d to the oeell~e the cuticle shows some sporadic s u b m e d i a n hairs.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Fig. 9.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Parachromagasteriella arctica, sp. n.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: a, anterior p a r t of t h e b o d y 1/12, ok. 3, × 600. b, tail 1/12, ok. 3, ×600.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: (Esophagus elongated, a b o u t e v e n l y thick, w i t h o u t bulb.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I m m e d i a t e l y in front of t h e lateral organs the ventral gland opens, the duct of which is dilated as an ampulla at t h e level o f t h e ocell~e. The gland itself is p r o b a b l y s i t u a t e d 0.163 ram. c a u d a d to t h e (esophagus.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: I t is v e r y large, of uniform s t r u c t u r e and provided with a nucleus in its posterior part.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The tail is slemler, cylindro-conical, in the posterior p a r t more sharply narrowed, thinned, at t h e end swollen, with end tip. The anterior half contains three large glands with nuclei.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The vulva is s i t u a t e d almost e x a c t l y in the middle of t h e body. Femalc organs are strongly developed, with the egg cells arranged in a single row.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: This species is closely related to the marine species Parachromagasteriella (~ylindricauda, described from some a d u l t specimens b y t h e a u t h o r (1933, p. 111, pl. xvii, fig. 72 a-c) from t h e Trondheimsfiord (litteral region of the biological station a t Trondheim).

sec.p: The cuticle is s m o o t h a n d the h e a d is rounded, p r o v i d e d with v e r y short, s u b m e d i a n bristles.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The elongated, pyrifbrm, g r a n u l a t e d v e n t r a l gland is s i t u a t e d only a short distance behind the (esophagus and is p r o v i d e d with a central nucleus.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The tail is short, conical and contains in the anterior half three large glands with central nuclei. I t is p r o v i d e d with a short, conical end tip. Egg cells large.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The t~,w specimens of a Monhysterid from E6 agree so well with M. agilis t h a t, although no male is at hand, I m u s t regard t h e m as s y n o n y m o u s

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: with t h a t species. T h e y are easily recognized b y t h e large cephalic bristles, the small fine hairs on the whole b o d y, and tile shape o f the h e a d and the tail.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The b o d y o f the J a n Mayen specimens, which is t h i c k e s t in front of the vulva, tapers t o w a r d s b o t h extremities gradually a n d is provided with sporadic, v e r y fine, s u b m e d i a n hairs.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: Cuticle smooth. The head is t r u n c a t e to rounded. A t t h e f r o n t e n d there are some short bristles. Behind these the h e a d is p r o v i d e d with two lateral solitary bristles a n d four s u b m e d i a n pairs of bristles, the anterior of which pair is 1/3 shorter t h a n the posterior ones, whose length is equal to the corresponding h e a d -d i a m e t e r at their level.

sec.title: Orphanage
sec.p: The buccal c a v i t y is large, a b o u t twice as b r o a d as deep.

sec.p: The tail is v e r y similar t o t h a t of M. filiformis, elongated, a t first gradually tapering, in the posterior p a r t thinner a n d w i t h a small end tip.
